meanings.definition: Inclined or sloping in one direction
meanings.sent1: The roof of the old house was slantier than the new one.
meanings.sent2: She placed the book on the slantier shelf to keep it from falling.
meanings.sent3: The slantier sidewalk made it challenging to walk without tripping.
meanings.sent4: His smile was slantier than usual, hinting at a hidden secret.
meanings.sent5: The slantier tree leaned towards the sunlight, reaching for warmth.

meanings.definition: Having a bias or skewed perspective
meanings.sent1: The slantier news article only showed one side of the story.
meanings.sent2: Her slantier view on the topic made it hard to have a balanced discussion.
meanings.sent3: His slantier opinion on pizza toppings led to a funny debate at the party.
meanings.sent4: The slantier mirror distorted her reflection, making her look taller than she was.
meanings.sent5: The slantier camera angle made the building appear taller than it actually was.
